title:
Remark on Well-posedness of Quadratic Schrödinger equation with
  nonlinearity $u\bar u$ in $H^{-1/4}(\R)$

title_detail.value:
Remark on Well-posedness of Quadratic Schrödinger equation with
  nonlinearity $u\bar u$ in $H^{-1/4}(\R)$

summary:
In this remark, we give another approach to the local well-posedness of
quadratic Schr\"odinger equation with nonlinearity $u\bar u$ in $H^{-1/4}$,
which was already proved by Kishimoto \cite{kis}. Our resolution space is
$l^1$-analogue of $X^{s,b}$ space with low frequency part in a weaker space
$L^{\infty}_{t}L^2_x$. Such type spaces was developed by Guo. \cite{G} to deal
the KdV endpoint $H^{-3/4}$ regularity.

summary_detail.value:
In this remark, we give another approach to the local well-posedness of
quadratic Schr\"odinger equation with nonlinearity $u\bar u$ in $H^{-1/4}$,
which was already proved by Kishimoto \cite{kis}. Our resolution space is
$l^1$-analogue of $X^{s,b}$ space with low frequency part in a weaker space
$L^{\infty}_{t}L^2_x$. Such type spaces was developed by Guo. \cite{G} to deal
the KdV endpoint $H^{-3/4}$ regularity.

author: Yuzhao Wang
fulltext:
arXiv:0910.0939v3 [math.AP] 5 Jan 2010

REMARK ON WELL-POSEDNESS OF QUADRATIC SCHRÖDINGER
EQUATION WITH NONLINEARITY uu IN H −1/4 (R)
YUZHAO WANG
Abstract. In this note, we give another approach to the local well-posedness of quadratic
Schrödinger equation with nonlinearity uu in H −1/4 , which was already proved by Kishimoto
[3]. Our resolution space is l1 -analogue of X s,b space with low frequency part in a weaker space
2
−3/4 regularity.
L∞
t Lx . Such type spaces were developed by Guo. [2] to deal the KdV endpoint H

1. Introduction
This paper is mainly concerned with the following equation

iut + uxx = |u|2 , u(x, t) : R × R → C,
u(x, 0) = φ(x) ∈ H s (R).

(1.1)

The low regularity for this equation was first studied by Kenig, Ponce, Vega in [4], they proved
the local well-posedness in H s , for s > −1/4, by using X s,b spaces. The local well-posedness in
H −1/4 was already proved by Kishimoto [3], where Kishimoto solved (1.1) in the spaces
Z = X −1/4,1/2+β + Y
and
Y = {f ∈ S ′ (R2 ); kf kY = khξi−1/4 hτ − ξ 2 i3β fˆkL2ξ Lpτ + khξi1/4−2β hτ − ξ 2 i3β fˆkL2ξ L2τ },
with 0 < β ≤ 1/24, 2β < 1/p′ < 3β and 1/p + 1/p′ = 1.
We give another approach based on the argument developed by Guo. [2], which solved the global
well-posedness for KdV equation in H −3/4 . Our resolution space is l1 -analogue of X s,b space with
2
low frequency part in a weaker space L∞
t Lx , so as a resolution space, it has simple form.
s,b
It is well known that X failed for (1.1) in H −1/4 because of the logarithmic divergences from
high × high → low interactions, it is natural to use the weaker structure in low frequency. We
2
2 ∞
use L∞
t Lx to measure the low frequency part, however in [2] Guo used Lx Lt . The reason for this
is that in the KdV case, the high × low interactions has one derivative, and the smoothing effect
2
norm L∞
x Lt was needed to absorb it. This method can also be adapted to other similar problems
where some logarithmic divergences appear in the high-high interactions.
Theorem 1.1. The initial value problem (1.1) is local well-posedness in H −1/4 .
For f ∈ S ′ we denote by fb or F (f ) the Fourier transform of f . We denote by Fx the Fourier
transform on spatial variable. Let Z and N be the sets of integers and natural numbers respectively,
Z+ = N ∪ {0}. For k ∈ Z+ let Ik = {ξ : |ξ| ∈ [2k−1 , 2k+1 ]}, k ≥ 1; I0 = {ξ : |ξ| ≤ 2}. Let η0 : R →
[0, 1] denote an even smooth function supported in [−8/5, 8/5] and equal to 1 in [−5/4, 5/4]. We
define ψ(t) = η0 (t). For k ∈ Z let ηk (ξ) = η0 (ξ/2k ) − η0 (ξ/2k−1 ) if k ≥ 1 and ηk (ξ) ≡ 0 if k ≤ −1.

Let a1 , a2 , a3 ∈ R, define amax = max {a1 , a2 , a2 }, same as amin , amed . Usually we use k1 , k2 , k3
and j1 , j2 , j3 to denote integers, Ni = 2ki and Li = 2ji for i = 1, 2, 3 to denote dyadic numbers.

2. Dyadic Bilinear Estimates
In this section we will give some dyadic bilinear estimates for next section. We define
Dk,j = {(ξ, τ ) : ξ ∈ [2k−1 , 2k+1 ] and τ + ξ 2 ∈ Ij },

k ∈ Z, j ∈ Z+ .

special structure in low frequency, and standard X s,b argument will suffice, we omit the proof.

References
[1] A. D. Ionescu, C. E. Kenig, Global well-posedness of the Benjamin-Ono equation in low-regularity spaces, J.
Amer. Math. Soc., 20 (2007), no. 3, 753-798.
[2] Z. Guo, Global well-posedness of Korteweg-de Vries equationin H −1/4 (R). J.Math.Pures Appl.91(2009)583-597
[3] N. Kishimoto, Low-regularity local well-posedness for quadratic nonlinear Schrödinger equations, preprint.
[4] C. E. Kenig, G. Ponce, and L. Vega, Quadratic forms for the 1-D semilinear Schrödinger equation, Trans. Amer.
Math. Soc. 348 (1996), no. 8, 3323-3353.
[5] T. Tao, Multiplinear weighted convolution of L2 functions and applications to nonlinear dispersive equations.
